Luhut Sebut Kerja Sama Garuda-Sriwijaya Diperpanjang 3 Bulan
07 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Uji Medianti Sukma

Jakarta - Kerja sama PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk dan PT Sriwijaya Air diperpanjang 3 bulan ke depan. Keputusan ini terjadi setelah Direktur Utama Garuda Indonesia Ari Askhara dan salah satu pemegang saham Sriwijaya Yusril Ihza Mahendra bertemu di Kantor Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi.Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan mengatakan, selain diperpanjang, kerja sama ini akan diaudit oleh Badan Pengawasan Keuangan dan Pembangunan (BPKP)."Garuda tadi kita sudah sepakat, (kerja sama) ditandatangani selama 3 bulan ke depan, kemudian dilakukan audit terhadap kerja sama ini oleh BPKP. Itu sudah mulai berjalan. Kita harapkan audit itu akan keluar hasilnya mungkin dalam seminggu atau 10 hari ke depan," kata Luhut di kantornya, Jakarta, Kamis (7/10/2019).Keterlibatan BPKP ini lantaran Sriwijaya memiliki sejumlah utang."Iya, karena ada yang punya utang sana, utang sini, teknis lah. Ya biar mengaudit, karena kita bekerja jangan meraba-raba. Kita kerja dasarnya hasil audit," ujarnya.Sementara, Yusril mengatakan, setelah diperpanjang kerja sama antara Garuda dan Sriwijaya akan direvisi. Namun, pihaknya juga meminta pertimbangan pemegang saham mayoritas apakah kerja sama ini akan lanjut atau tidak."Kemudian dalam waktu tidak terlalu lama segera revisi atas perjanjian Sriwijaya dan pihak Garuda akan kami lakukan segera. Tentu saya akan bertanya pemegang saham mayoritas Sriwijaya apakah akan menerima proposal ini, meneruskan kerja sama ini atau malah menghentikannya sama sekali itu nanti diputuskan segera 1-2 hari ini," ungkapnya.Dia juga memberi catatan, saat kerja sama direvisi pihak Sriwijaya meminta adanya perubahan direksi. Hal itu dilakukan supaya tidak ada konflik kepentingan."Yang tadi disepakati adalah bahwa perjanjian sementara diperpanjang disepakati 3 bulan, tapi segera diadakan revisi kalau revisi selesai kemudian penggantian direksi supaya tidak terjadi conflict of interest kan agak susah orang Garuda me-manage Sriwijaya," katanya."Sementara ini kan ada konflik kepentingan, dua-duanya ingin untung ingin sama-sama maju tapi ada proposal juga yang harus dipertimbangkan. Kalau memang itu kerja sama operasi atau manajemen itu harus diatur legalnya sangat rigid sehingga tidak terjadi konflik kepentingan antara manajemen yang berasal dari Garuda tetapi masuk ke Sriwijaya. Tapi kemudian misalnya line-line gemuk Sriwijaya ditutup diganti Citilink kan jadi masalah juga," ungkapnya.Simak Video "Ratusan Penumpang Sriwijaya Air Telantar di Bandara Hasanuddin"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

Luhut Call Garuda-Sriwijaya Cooperation Extended 3 Months
07 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Medianti Sukma Test

Jakarta - The cooperation between PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk and PT Sriwijaya Air is extended in the next 3 months. This decision came after Garuda Indonesia Managing Director Ari Askhara and one of Sriwijaya shareholders Yusril Ihza Mahendra met at the Maritime and Investment Coordinating Ministry Office. The Coordinating Minister for Maritime and Investment Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said, besides being extended, this cooperation would be audited by the Agency for Maritime Affairs and Investment. Financial Supervision and Development (BPKP). "Garuda, we agreed, (the cooperation) was signed for the next 3 months, then an audit of this cooperation was carried out by BPKP. It has begun to run. We hope that the audit will come out as a result. the next week or 10 days, "Luhut said in his office, Jakarta, Thursday (10/07/2019). The involvement of BPKP was because Sriwijaya had a number of debts." Yes, because there are those who have debts there, debts here, technical here. let us audit, because we work, don't fumble. We work basically the results of an audit, "he said. Meanwhile, Yusril said, after being extended Cooperation between Garuda and Sriwijaya will be revised. However, he also asked the majority shareholders to consider whether this cooperation would continue or not. "Then in the not too soon revision of the Srivijaya agreement and Garuda's party we would do it immediately. Of course I would ask Sriwijaya's majority shareholder whether to accept the proposal this, continuing this cooperation or even stopping it altogether was later decided as soon as 1-2 days, "he said. He also noted, when the cooperation was revised the Srivijaya requested a change of directors. This was done so that there were no conflicts of interest. "What was agreed upon was that the provisional agreement was extended and agreed to 3 months, but a revision was immediately held if the revision was complete and then the replacement of directors to avoid a conflict of interest would be rather difficult for Garuda people to manage Sriwijaya," he said. "While there is a conflict of interest, both of them want to profit together, but there are proposals that must be considered as well. If indeed the operation or management cooperation must be regulated legally, it is rigid so that there is no conflict of interest between management originating. from Garuda but entered Sriwijaya. But then for example the fat lines of Sriwijaya were closed, and Citilink was replaced, it was also a problem, "he said.
